item.title: Libvirt and Vagrant
item.description: Libvirt is the default toolkit to manage virtualization platforms on Linux. Libvirt and qemu is a great combination with Vagrant. It’s the default combination on most Linux systems, also on my favorite - Fedora. This combination allows for some awesome features and some restrictions. One of the restrictions is that Ubuntu isn’t available as a box, but Debian is. And Debian is the foundation of Ubuntu, and it’s more open than Ubuntu.
